acknowledgments.summary: rgod, working with Trend Micro 's Zero Day Initiative, reported these vulnerabilities to CISA.

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.text: CISA recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage onus-cert.cisa.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.cisa.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities. These vulnerabilities are not exploitable remotely.
notes.title: Exploitability

notes.text: The affected product may allow an attacker to supply a pointer to arbitrary memory locations, which may allow an attacker to remotely execute arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Omron has released an updated version of CX-One to address the reported vulnerabilities. These releases are available through the CX-One auto-update service and are as follows: CX-Protocol: Version 2.03

Omron has released an updated version of CX-One to address the reported vulnerabilities. These releases are available through the CX-One auto-update service and are as follows: CX-Server: Version 5.0.29

Omron has released an updated version of CX-One to address the reported vulnerabilities. These releases are available through the CX-One auto-update service and are as follows: CX-Position Version 2.53

notes.text: The affected product is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, which may allow an attacker to remotely execute arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

cwe.name: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')

notes.text: This vulnerability allows local attackers to execute arbitrary code due to the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a type-confusion condition.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
